name: a(n) = (largest prime factor of n) minus (its remaining distinct prime factors).
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
xref: Cf. A212665 (positions of negative terms), A215142 (positions of ones), A382469 (positions of zeros).
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Mar 31 2025

name: Numbers k such that the largest prime factor of k equals the sum of its remaining distinct prime factors.
comment: A larger than usual number of terms is provided in order to distinguish this sequence from A365795, from which it first differs at n = 58 (a(58) = 3135 is missing from A365795).
First differs from A071140 at n = 140.
First differs from A221054 at n = 50. (End)
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Mar 31 2025
